info.name: Cultural-Social Environment
info.description: The external cultural, social, and informational context surrounding the individual, including family systems, social networks, media, cultural narratives, and morphic fields that influence motivation and values.

info.name: Social Environment
info.description: The originating cultural-social systems that generate and transmit morphic field signals, including family networks, peer groups, media systems, educational institutions, and broader cultural narratives that shape individual motivational patterns.

info.name: Social Environment
info.description: The broader social and cultural context that receives and responds to the individual's motivated behavior - family, community, institutions, and cultural systems that are influenced by but not modeled within our individual-focused analysis.

info.name: Human
info.description: The human individual experiencing motivational field dynamics

info.name: Individual Person Boundary
info.description: The physical and psychological boundary of the individual person - what is considered "inside" versus + "outside" the person being studied.

info.name: Social Brain Network
info.description:
Network of cortical regions including temporo-parietal junction, amygdala, and associated areas that process social information, cultural cues, and interpersonal dynamics - the neurological interface through which morphic field signals and cultural messages are received and interpreted.

https://mcgovern.mit.edu/2019/10/04/what-is-the-social-brain/
https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC1464100/

interfaces.protocol: 1. Cultural signal detection → 2. Social context interpretation → 3. Mental state attribution → 4. Emotional significance assessment → 5. Integration with corticolimbic processing

info.name: Corticolimbic System
info.description:
Neural circuits integrating emotion with cognition (prefrontal cortices, amygdala, and hippocampus) that produce flexible behavioral output based on environmental circumstances - the neurophysiological interface where motivational conflicts are processed and resolved into adaptive behavior.

https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/32680665/

interfaces.protocol: 1. Motivational input integration → 2. Emotional-cognitive conflict assessment → 3. Environmental context evaluation → 4. Flexible behavioral response selection → 5. Adaptive action execution

info.name: Morphic Field Signals
info.description: Cultural information patterns transmitted through social interactions, media exposure, family dynamics, and collective cultural narratives that carry motivational templates and value structures, influencing individual desire formation and behavioral expectations.

info.name: Motivated Behavior
info.description: Observable behavioral expressions of internal motivational processing, including decisions, actions, value statements, and lifestyle choices that communicate the individual's motivational state to their social environment and potentially influence cultural field patterns.
